segment.source: title: Work in Progress
segment.target: title: Work in Progress

segment.source: Work in Progress
segment.target: Work in Progress

segment.source: 12-Nov update.
segment.target: 12-Nov update.

segment.source: If you don't see your problem addressed here or have questions, post them on the forum.
segment.target: If you don't see your problem addressed here or have questions, post them on the forum.

segment.source: General functionality
segment.target: General functionality

segment.source: Windows Container Image must exactly match container host
segment.target: Windows Container Image must exactly match container host

segment.source: A Windows Server Container requires an operating system image that matches the container host in respect to build and patch level.
segment.target: A Windows Server Container requires an operating system image that matches the container host in respect to build and patch level.

segment.source: A mismatch will lead to instability and or unpredictable behavior for the container and/or the host.
segment.target: A mismatch will lead to instability and or unpredictable behavior for the container and/or the host.

segment.source: If you install updates against the Windows container host OS you will need to update the container base OS image to have the matching updates.
segment.target: If you install updates against the Windows container host OS you will need to update the container base OS image to have the matching updates.

segment.source: Download and install a container base image matching the OS version and patch level of the container host.
segment.target: Download and install a container base image matching the OS version and patch level of the container host.

segment.source: Commands sporadically fail -- try again
segment.target: Commands sporadically fail -- try again

segment.source: In our testing, commands occasionally need to be run multiple times.
segment.target: In our testing, commands occasionally need to be run multiple times.

segment.source: The same principle applies to other actions.
segment.target: The same principle applies to other actions.

segment.source: For example, if you create a new file and it doesn't appear, try touching the file.
segment.target: For example, if you create a new file and it doesn't appear, try touching the file.

segment.source: If you have to do this, let us know via the forums.
segment.target: If you have to do this, let us know via the forums.

segment.source: ** Work Around: **
segment.target: ** Work Around: **

segment.source: Build scripts such that they try commands multiple times.
segment.target: Build scripts such that they try commands multiple times.

segment.source: If a command fails, try again.
segment.target: If a command fails, try again.

segment.source: All non-C:/ drives are automatically mapped into new containers
segment.target: All non-C:/ drives are automatically mapped into new containers

segment.source: All non-C:/ drives available to the container host are automatically mapped into new running Windows Server Containers.
segment.target: All non-C:/ drives available to the container host are automatically mapped into new running Windows Server Containers.

segment.source: At this point in time there is no way to selectively map folders into a container, as an interim work around drives are mapped automatically.
segment.target: At this point in time there is no way to selectively map folders into a container, as an interim work around drives are mapped automatically.

segment.source: **Work Around: **
segment.target: **Work Around: **

segment.source: We're working on it.
segment.target: We're working on it.

segment.source: In the future there will be folder sharing.
segment.target: In the future there will be folder sharing.

segment.source: Windows Server Containers are starting very slowly
segment.target: Windows Server Containers are starting very slowly

segment.source: If your container is taking more than 30 seconds to start, it may be performing many duplicate virus scans.
segment.target: If your container is taking more than 30 seconds to start, it may be performing many duplicate virus scans.

segment.source: Many anti-malware solutions, such as Windows Defender, maybe unnecessarily scanning files with-in container images including all of the OS binaries and files in the container OS image.
segment.target: Many anti-malware solutions, such as Windows Defender, maybe unnecessarily scanning files with-in container images including all of the OS binaries and files in the container OS image.

segment.source: This occurs when ever a new container is created and from the anti-malware’s perspective all of the “container’s files” look like new files that have not previously been scanned.
segment.target: This occurs when ever a new container is created and from the anti-malware’s perspective all of the “container’s files” look like new files that have not previously been scanned.

segment.source: So when processes inside the container attempt to read these files the anti-malware components first scan them before allowing access to the files.
segment.target: So when processes inside the container attempt to read these files the anti-malware components first scan them before allowing access to the files.

segment.source: In reality these files were already scanned when the container image was imported or pulled to the server.
segment.target: In reality these files were already scanned when the container image was imported or pulled to the server.

segment.source: In future previews new infrastructure will be in place such that anti-malware solutions, including Windows Defender, will be aware of these situations and can act accordingly to avoid multiple scans.
segment.target: In future previews new infrastructure will be in place such that anti-malware solutions, including Windows Defender, will be aware of these situations and can act accordingly to avoid multiple scans.

segment.source: Networking
segment.target: Networking

segment.source: Number of network compartments per container
segment.target: Number of network compartments per container

segment.source: In this release we support one network compartment per container.
segment.target: In this release we support one network compartment per container.

segment.source: This means that if you have a container with multiple network adapters, you cannot access the same network port on each adapter (e.g. 192.168.0.1:80 and 192.168.0.2:80 belonging to the same container).
segment.target: This means that if you have a container with multiple network adapters, you cannot access the same network port on each adapter (e.g. 192.168.0.1:80 and 192.168.0.2:80 belonging to the same container).

segment.source: **Work Around: **
segment.target: **Work Around: **

segment.source: If multiple endpoints need to be exposed by a container, use NAT port mapping.
segment.target: If multiple endpoints need to be exposed by a container, use NAT port mapping.

segment.source: Windows containers are not getting IPs
segment.target: Windows containers are not getting IPs

segment.source: If you're connecting to the windows server containers with DHCP VM Switches it's possible for the container host to recieve an IP wwhile the containers do not.
segment.target: If you're connecting to the windows server containers with DHCP VM Switches it's possible for the container host to recieve an IP wwhile the containers do not.

segment.source: The containers get a 169.254..
segment.target: The containers get a 169.254..

segment.source: APIPA IP address.
segment.target: APIPA IP address.

segment.source: Work around:
segment.target: Work around:

segment.source: This is a side effect of sharing the kernel.
segment.target: This is a side effect of sharing the kernel.

segment.source: All containers affectively have the same mac address.
segment.target: All containers affectively have the same mac address.

segment.source: Enable MAC address spoofing on the container host.
segment.target: Enable MAC address spoofing on the container host.

segment.source: This can be achieved using PowerShell
segment.target: This can be achieved using PowerShell

segment.source: Creating file shares does not work in a Container
segment.target: Creating file shares does not work in a Container

segment.source: Currently it is not possible to create a file share within a Container.
segment.target: Currently it is not possible to create a file share within a Container.

segment.source: If you run you will see an error like this:
segment.target: If you run you will see an error like this:

segment.source: **Work Around: **
segment.target: **Work Around: **

segment.source: If you want to copy files into a Container you can use the other way round by running within the Container.
segment.target: If you want to copy files into a Container you can use the other way round by running within the Container.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Application compatibility
segment.target: Application compatibility

segment.source: There are so mnay questions about which applications work and don't work in Windows Server Containers, we decided to break application compatability information into its own article.
segment.target: There are so mnay questions about which applications work and don't work in Windows Server Containers, we decided to break application compatability information into its own article.

segment.source: Some of the most common issues are located here as well.
segment.target: Some of the most common issues are located here as well.

segment.source: WinRM won't start in a Windows Server Container
segment.target: WinRM won't start in a Windows Server Container

segment.source: WinRM starts, throws an error, and stops again.
segment.target: WinRM starts, throws an error, and stops again.

segment.source: Errors are not logged in the event log.
segment.target: Errors are not logged in the event log.

segment.source: Work Around:
segment.target: Work Around:

segment.source: Use WMI, RDP, or Enter-PSSession -ContainerID
segment.target: Use WMI, RDP, or Enter-PSSession -ContainerID

segment.source: Can't install ASP.NET 4.5 or ASP.NET 3.5 with IIS in a container using DISM
segment.target: Can't install ASP.NET 4.5 or ASP.NET 3.5 with IIS in a container using DISM

segment.source: Installing IIS-ASPNET45 in a container doesn't work inside a Windows Server container.
segment.target: Installing IIS-ASPNET45 in a container doesn't work inside a Windows Server container.

segment.source: The installation progress sticks around 95.5%.
segment.target: The installation progress sticks around 95.5%.

segment.source: This fails because ASP.NET 4.5 doesn't run in a container.
segment.target: This fails because ASP.NET 4.5 doesn't run in a container.

segment.source: Work Around:
segment.target: Work Around:

segment.source: Instead, install the Web-Server role to use IIS.
segment.target: Instead, install the Web-Server role to use IIS.

segment.source: ASP 5.0 does work.
segment.target: ASP 5.0 does work.

segment.source: See the application compatability article for more information about what applications can be containerized.
segment.target: See the application compatability article for more information about what applications can be containerized.

segment.source: Pasting commands to interactive Docker session is limited to 50 characters
segment.target: Pasting commands to interactive Docker session is limited to 50 characters

segment.source: If you copy a command line into an interactive Docker session, it is currently limited to 50 characters.
segment.target: If you copy a command line into an interactive Docker session, it is currently limited to 50 characters.

segment.source: The pasted string is simply truncated.
segment.target: The pasted string is simply truncated.

segment.source: This is not by design, we're working on lifting the restriction.
segment.target: This is not by design, we're working on lifting the restriction.

segment.source: net use returns System error 1223 instead of prompting for username or password
segment.target: net use returns System error 1223 instead of prompting for username or password

segment.source: Workaround: specify both, the username and password, when running net use.
segment.target: Workaround: specify both, the username and password, when running net use.

segment.source: HCS Shim errors when creating new container images
segment.target: HCS Shim errors when creating new container images

segment.source: If you encounter error messages like this:
segment.target: If you encounter error messages like this:

segment.source: You're hitting an issue addressed by the Zero Day Patch for Windows Server 2016 TP3.
segment.target: You're hitting an issue addressed by the Zero Day Patch for Windows Server 2016 TP3.

segment.source: This error can also occur when running the Python-3.4.3.msi installer or node-v0.12.7.msi in a container.
segment.target: This error can also occur when running the Python-3.4.3.msi installer or node-v0.12.7.msi in a container.

segment.source: If you hit other hcsshim errors, let us know via the forums.
segment.target: If you hit other hcsshim errors, let us know via the forums.

segment.source: Accessing windows server container with Remote Desktop
segment.target: Accessing windows server container with Remote Desktop

segment.source: Windows Server Containers can be managed/interacted with through a RDP session.
segment.target: Windows Server Containers can be managed/interacted with through a RDP session.

segment.source: The following steps are needed to remotely connect to a Windows Server Container using RDP.
segment.target: The following steps are needed to remotely connect to a Windows Server Container using RDP.

segment.source: It is assumed that the Container is connected to the network via a NAT switch.
segment.target: It is assumed that the Container is connected to the network via a NAT switch.

segment.source: This is the default when setting up a Container host through the installation script or creating a new VM in Azure.
segment.target: This is the default when setting up a Container host through the installation script or creating a new VM in Azure.

segment.source: ** In the Container you want to connect to **
segment.target: ** In the Container you want to connect to **

segment.source: The following steps require either managing the Container using Docker or, when using PowerShell, specifying the switch when connecting to the Container.
segment.target: The following steps require either managing the Container using Docker or, when using PowerShell, specifying the switch when connecting to the Container.

segment.source: Please take the following steps in the Container you want to connect to.
segment.target: Please take the following steps in the Container you want to connect to.

segment.source: Obtain the Container's IP address
segment.target: Obtain the Container's IP address

segment.source: Returns something similar to this
segment.target: Returns something similar to this

segment.source: Please note the IPv4 Address which is typically in the format 172.16.x.x
segment.target: Please note the IPv4 Address which is typically in the format 172.16.x.x

segment.source: Set the password for the builtin administrator user for the Container
segment.target: Set the password for the builtin administrator user for the Container

segment.source: Enable the builtin administrator user for the Container
segment.target: Enable the builtin administrator user for the Container

segment.source: ** On the Container host **
segment.target: ** On the Container host **

segment.source: Since Windows Server has the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security enabled by default we need to open some ports for communication in order for RDP to work.
segment.target: Since Windows Server has the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security enabled by default we need to open some ports for communication in order for RDP to work.

segment.source: Additionally a port mapping is created so the Container is reachable through a port on the Container host.
segment.target: Additionally a port mapping is created so the Container is reachable through a port on the Container host.

segment.source: The following steps require a PowerShell launched as Administrator on the Container host.
segment.target: The following steps require a PowerShell launched as Administrator on the Container host.

segment.source: Allow the default RDP port through the Windows Advanced Firewall
segment.target: Allow the default RDP port through the Windows Advanced Firewall

segment.source: Allow an additional port for RDP connection to the Container
segment.target: Allow an additional port for RDP connection to the Container

segment.source: This step opens up port 3390 on the Container host.
segment.target: This step opens up port 3390 on the Container host.

segment.source: It will be used to open a RDP session to the Container.
segment.target: It will be used to open a RDP session to the Container.

segment.source: If you want to connect to multiple Containers, you can repeat this step while providing additional port numbers.
segment.target: If you want to connect to multiple Containers, you can repeat this step while providing additional port numbers.

segment.source: Add a port mapping for the existing NAT
segment.target: Add a port mapping for the existing NAT

segment.source: In this step you need the IP address from step 1 within the Container
segment.target: In this step you need the IP address from step 1 within the Container

segment.source: Here you ensure that communication to the Container host which is coming in on port 3390 is redirected to port 3389 on the Container running at the IP address you specify.
segment.target: Here you ensure that communication to the Container host which is coming in on port 3390 is redirected to port 3389 on the Container running at the IP address you specify.

segment.source: ** Connect to the container via RDP **
segment.target: ** Connect to the container via RDP **

segment.source: Finally you can connect to the Container using RDP.
segment.target: Finally you can connect to the Container using RDP.

segment.source: In order to do that please run the following command on a system which has the Remote Desktop Client installed (e.g. your system running the Container host VM):
segment.target: In order to do that please run the following command on a system which has the Remote Desktop Client installed (e.g. your system running the Container host VM):

segment.source: Please specify as the user name and the password that you chose as the password.
segment.target: Please specify as the user name and the password that you chose as the password.

segment.source: The Remote Desktop Connection will ask you whether you want connect to the system despite certificate errors.
segment.target: The Remote Desktop Connection will ask you whether you want connect to the system despite certificate errors.

segment.source: If you select "Yes", the RDP connection will be opened.
segment.target: If you select "Yes", the RDP connection will be opened.

segment.source: Note: Exiting the container RDP session without logoff may prevent the container from shutting down.
segment.target: Note: Exiting the container RDP session without logoff may prevent the container from shutting down.

segment.source: Please make sure to exit the RDP session by typing "logoff" (instead of "exit" or just closing the RDP window) before shutting the container down.
segment.target: Please make sure to exit the RDP session by typing "logoff" (instead of "exit" or just closing the RDP window) before shutting the container down.

segment.source: PowerShell management
segment.target: PowerShell management

segment.source: Enter-PSSession has containerid argument, New-PSSession doesn't
segment.target: Enter-PSSession has containerid argument, New-PSSession doesn't

segment.source: This is correct.
segment.target: This is correct.

segment.source: We're planning on full cimsession support in the future.
segment.target: We're planning on full cimsession support in the future.

segment.source: Feel free to voice feature requests in the forums.
segment.target: Feel free to voice feature requests in the forums.
